Articles.Content:
whats the heaviest payload you have sent up to orbit or beyond

personally i just sent up the 175.16 ton base of my Orion space station

https://imgur.com/a/KQlZ3#0

*i dont know how to embed imgur albums*

i did not even think it would work but it did i feel so happy

this thread is loaded with competition for you:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/51828-What-s-the-highest-mass-you-ve-ever-put-into-Kerbin-orbit-with-a-single-ship

incidentally, so is this one:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83352-While-I-will-not-get-to-compete-in-the-Kerbal-Cup

*Waits patiently for whackjob*

My personal record is just above 600. I plan to orbit 3k soon.

EDIT: there he is (kinda)
Probably my kethane refinery

I don't know exactly, but when my Jool5 ship was almost to LKO it was 374 tons. I sadly cut out the finishing burn to orbit so it was probably a few tons less. My poor computer barely got that into orbit so I don't think I could do much more, though part count was the big limiting factor so if all I launched was a whole bunch of orange tanks I bet I could have done more tonnage.

The largest thing I launched successfully in a single launch was probably something like 130 tons in payload or so I think (I think it was my recent ship to Dres). However, I'm currently designing my largest combined ship, which looks like will be approaching 800-900 tons in orbit, though that will be assembled in orbit

About 1000t to 100 km orbit in a single launch. Heaviest ship assembled in orbit has about 6400t

Edited June 17, 2014 by theend3r

My largest single-launch payload was 1100 tons (1500 tons to orbit total), which was 7500 tons on the pad:

Onion staged, with very little spin.

Edited June 18, 2014 by NecroBones
